alert.note: Alert for Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Ulster County through 500 PM EDT... At 415 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Woodbourne, or 10 miles east of Liberty, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... West Shokan, Napanoch, Olivebridge, Kerhonkson, Wawarsing, Denning, Cherrytown, Samsonville, Palentown, Atwood, Sundown, Pacama, Brodhead, Liebhardt, Fantinekill, Dairyland, Branch, Mombaccus, Honk Hill and Greenfield Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
